item.title: Marshawn Lynch Hasn't Spent Any Of The $50MM He's Earned From The NFL
item.description:
Marshawn Lynch Hasn't Spent Any Of The $50MM He's Earned From The NFL

Seattle Seahawks star running back Marshawn Lynch has made $49.7 million in nine NFL seasons--and saved all of it. In a recent segment for The Ian & Puck Show on 950 AM KJR in Seattle, Ian Rapoport of the NFL Network was discussing recent rumblings that Lynch might retire and dropped an interesting tidbit about Lynch's thriftiness.

item.title: Alex Rodriguez would "like to help out in financial literacy for the Hispanic community and the athletic community."
item.description:
Alex Rodriguez would "like to help out in financial literacy for the Hispanic community and the athletic community."

Set-up Google Alerts this morning and guess what I find, a gem. The USA Today article doesn't go into detail about how or what he plans to do. Hopefully Google Alerts will let me know when there's more.

item.title: Don't Teach Children About Money In School
item.description:
Don't Teach Children About Money In School

Schools are burdened with the task of creating functional people. Society desires more bodies to make more bodies to fill the 5,400,000 great open jobs in the United States. The classroom time is better utilized giving them marketable skills. Once the students get the jobs and the salaries they'll use the income to learn about money. The best way to learn anything is through experience. The experience of investing, spending, and earning will teach this and future generations as it has taught past generations about money.
